se.jguru.nazgul.core.quickstart.api.generator

Class AbstractComponentFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jguru.nazgul.core.quickstart.api.generator.AbstractFactory
      • se.jguru.nazgul.core.quickstart.api.generator.AbstractComponentFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentFactory

    public abstract class AbstractComponentFactory
extends AbstractFactory
implements ComponentFactory
    Abstract ComponentFactory implementation sporting utility methods and VCS/Project navigation facilities.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractComponentFactory

        protected AbstractComponentFactory(NamingStrategy namingStrategy,
                                   StructureNavigator structureNavigator)
        Creates a new AbstractComponentFactory wrapping the supplied NamingStrategy.
        Parameters:
        structureNavigator - A StructureNavigator used to navigate the project in which this AbstractComponentFactory should create Software Components or SoftwareComponentParts.
        namingStrategy - The active NamingStrategy, used to validate supplied data.

    • Method Detail

      • createSoftwareComponent

        public final void createSoftwareComponent(File componentDirectory,
                                          SortedMap<SoftwareComponentPart,String> parts2SuffixMap)
                                   throws InvalidStructureException
        Creates a new SoftwareComponent containing the supplied parts in the given componentDirectory.
        Specified by:
        createSoftwareComponent in interface ComponentFactory
        Parameters:
        componentDirectory - An non-existent or empty directory where a SoftwareComponent should be created. The directory name will be identical to the SoftwareComponent name, and must therefore be compliant with the NamingStrategy in use.
        parts2SuffixMap - A non-empty Map relating SoftwareComponentParts to be created within the SoftwareComponent to their respective suffix. A non-empty value is only required within the Map if SoftwareComponentPart.isSuffixRequired() yields true.
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - If componentDirectory already contained a POM, or was not compliant with the NamingStrategy chosen. Also thrown if the parts list is empty or holds an Implementation SoftwareComponentPart but neither API nor SPI SoftwareComponentParts.

      • addSoftwareComponentPart

        public void addSoftwareComponentPart(File componentReactorDirectory,
                                     SoftwareComponentPart toAdd,
                                     String suffix)
                              throws InvalidStructureException
        Adds a SoftwareComponentPart to the SoftwareComponent found within the supplied componentDirectory.
        Specified by:
        addSoftwareComponentPart in interface ComponentFactory
        Parameters:
        componentReactorDirectory - A directory containing an existing SoftwareComponent (i.e. containing the reactor POM of the SoftwareComponent).
        toAdd - The SoftwareComponentPart to add to the supplied SoftwareComponent.
        suffix - The suffix of the SoftwareComponent's type. Ignored unless toAdd.isSuffixRequired() yields true.
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - if the supplied componentDirectory did not contain a SoftwareComponent, or if the toAdd SoftwareComponentPart was already present within the componentDirectory directory.
        See Also:
        SoftwareComponentPart.isSuffixRequired()

      • createMavenProjectForSoftwareComponentPart

        protected void createMavenProjectForSoftwareComponentPart(SoftwareComponentPart part,
                                                          File mavenProjectDir,
                                                          String reactorPomMavenVersion,
                                                          String parentPomMavenVersion,
                                                          Project project,
                                                          String optionalGroupIdPrefix,
                                                          String partSuffix)
        Creates a maven project within mavenProjectDir for a SoftwareComponentPart of the supplied type. This is a convenience method to create Maven project structures for SoftwareComponentParts. (I.e. not a generic Maven project creation method).
        Parameters:
        part - The non-null SoftwareComponentPart indicating which type of project should be created.
        mavenProjectDir - The directory where the maven project should be generated. Must exist and be a directory.
        reactorPomMavenVersion - The non-empty Maven project version of reactor POMs within the project. Should be identical to the version of the reactor parent POM.
        parentPomMavenVersion - The non-empty Maven project version of parent POMs within the project (and, normally, the version of all leaf projects within the Maven project reactor). Should be identical to the version of the parent parent POM.
        project - The non-null Project data, primarily used to initialize the active TokenParser.
        optionalGroupIdPrefix - The groupId prefix (commonly the reverse DNS, similar to se.jguru or org.apache) of the organisation that owns the project created. The groupId prefix is prepended to the groupId of the created Maven project.
        partSuffix - The suffix of the project SoftwareComponentPart project, used only if SoftwareComponentPart.isSuffixRequired() yields true.

      • generateReactorPom

        protected void generateReactorPom(File softwareComponentDir)
        Generates a reactor POM in the supplied softwareComponentDir directory. Also - before calling this method, the REACTOR_ROOT pom must exist.
        Parameters:
        softwareComponentDir - A directory which must exist and be located within a Maven reactor.

      • extractTemplateFiles

        protected File extractTemplateFiles(String tmpDirName,
                                    String templateResourcePath)
        Performs three tasks:
        1. Converts the supplied templateResourcePath to a URL
        2. Creates a temporary directory with the local path "template/" + tmpDirName + "_" + i under the standard temporary directory path
        3. Extracts all resources found in the Classpath under the templateResourcePath to the created temporary directory
        Parameters:
        tmpDirName - The name of the temporary directory to which the templates should be extracted.
        templateResourcePath - The resource path (not starting with '/') under which all templates are found.
        Returns:
        The root directory under which all templates were extracted.

      • getProjectGroupIdPrefix

        protected String getProjectGroupIdPrefix(String rootReactorGroupId,
                                         String rootReactorArtifactId)
        Retrieves the prefix to be prepended to groupIds within the project. Normally, the project's groupIdPrefix is identical to the reverse DNS of the organisation hosting the project, plus the name of the project itself. Override this method if you choose to derive the project's groupId prefix in another way. The default implementation strips the type suffix from rootReactorArtifactId and converts the remainder to a path snippet, used as a delimiter to strip of the previous part from the rootReactorGroupId. This is illustrated by an example.
        1. Given rootReactorGroupId: se.jguru.nazgul.core, and
        2. Given rootReactorArtifactId: nazgul-core-reactor
        3. First, the prefix and name of the rootReactorArtifactId is joined with the Name.DEFAULT_SEPARATOR yielding nazgul.core
        4. The return value is found as a substring of the rootReactorGroupId up until the prefix snippet is found, stripping off the trailing ".": se.jguru
        Override this method if your concrete ComponentFactory uses another algorithm to acquire the projectGroupIdPrefix.
        Parameters:
        rootReactorGroupId - The groupId of the root reactor POM within the project.
        rootReactorArtifactId - The artifactId of the root reactor POM within the project.
        Returns:
        the projectGroupIdPrefix, prepended to the relative path of a software component to retrieve the full groupID within its POM.
